business.headline: Al Hind Air, FlyExpress get NOCs as government looks to widen airline choicesAl Hind Air and FlyExpress have received no objection certificates from the civil aviation ministry, as the government looks to reduce heavy dependence on a few airlines following recent disruption at IndiGo.
Sensex ends 116 points lower, Nifty below 26,200; Trent gained 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 116.14 points to close at 85,408.70, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 35.05 points to end at 85,408.70.

Facing pension delays? EPFO sets new rules to fix EPS contribution mistakesPension delays have long been a worry for many employees. To address this, the EPFO has introduced new rules to correct mistakes in EPS contributions and ensure pension claims are settled smoothly.

8th Pay Commission: How the fitment factor will shape salary and pension increasesAs talks around the 8th Pay Commission gather pace, government employees and pensioners are closely watching one number that could change their monthly income. The fitment factor is set to be the main driver of salary and pension revisions under the new pay panel.

Still waiting for your income tax refund? Simple ways to check your ITR statusWaiting for an income tax refund can be frustrating, especially after filing your return on time. While delays are common, tracking your ITR status online is easy and can give you clarity on where things stand.

Pakistan sells national carrier PIA for Rs 4,300 crore following bidding processThe privatisation ceremony was held in Islamabad and was attended by all three pre-qualified bidders. These included Lucky Cement, private airline Airblue and investment firm Arif Habib.

Coal India shares continue to rally. What's behind the rise?Coal India's sharp rally reflects a mix of restructuring signals, strong fundamentals and sector-wide PSU momentum. With multiple subsidiaries headed for listings, investors see fresh value creation opportunities driving renewed interest in the stock.

Saleem Ahmad takes charge as RVNL CMD, replacing Sukhmal Chand JainSaleem Ahmad is a civil engineering graduate from Jamia Millia Islamia University and brings more than 35 years of experience across large-scale construction and infrastructure projects.

Do you need to file revised ITR after the Income Tax Department's message?The tax department's risk management alert serves as a cautionary prompt, not a formal notice. Taxpayers need revised ITRs only if there are mismatches. Those with correct claims can wait as refunds resume after verification.

Gold rallies to fresh high: Key reasons behind rally and support levels to watchSpot gold rose 0.8% to a fresh all-time high of $4,524 per ounce. With this jump, gold has gained around 72% so far this year.

ITR on hold? Tax department issues clarification on 'risk management' alertsThe tax department's latest clarification aims to ease taxpayer anxiety, stressing that the alerts are advisory and encourage voluntary correction. Refunds will resume once discrepancies are fixed or claims are verified as genuine.
Coca-Cola India bottler HCCB announces plan to lay off 300 workersHindustan Coca-Cola Beverages (HCCB) currently has around 5,000 employees across India and operates 15 manufacturing units.

Gujarat Kidney IPO closes today: Should you subscribe? Here's what GMP suggestsGujarat Kidney IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 250.80 crore. The entire issue is a fresh issue of 2.20 crore equity shares, with no offer for sale component. This means all the money raised through the IPO will go to the company.

Why some celebrity brands thrive while others fadeFrom Katrina Kaif's Kay Beauty to Kusha Kapila's Underneat, celebrity brands are no longer side projects. While some scale steadily and earn consumer trust, others struggle to outgrow launch buzz. What explains this divide?

Robin Raina denies Eraaya allegations, says 50% shareholding case is still openIn a statement released on December 23, 2025, Robin Raina said that Eraaya Lifespaces has been spreading incorrect information through repeated media statements

Planning to change jobs? Why you should not withdraw your PFA new job usually means better prospects and a fresh start. Yet, in the rush to move on, one costly mistake is common: withdrawing your PF. What feels like easy money today can hurt your long-term financial security.

Tax refund put on hold under risk management? What the message meansA sudden message from the income tax department has unsettled many taxpayers, who are unsure why their returns are under review. Here is all you need to know.
Sensex, Nifty give up early gains to end lower as investors book profitsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 42.64 points to close at 85,524.84, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 4.75 points to end at 26,177.15.

Buy now or wait? Why delaying a home purchase can cost you more than you expectIs waiting really the wiser choice for homebuyers, or can rising prices turn patience into a costly mistake? Let's break it down.

VRS or early retirement? Why your PF needs a new story for a new lifeVoluntary Retirement Schemes, or VRS, and early exits, once seen as dramatic decisions, have now become part of real conversations in many households.

entertainment.headline: Shweta Tripathi shares BTS pics from Mirzapur film sets: Best moments of 2025 Shweta Tripathi called the start of Mirzapur: The Movie shoot one of the best moments of her 2025 as she shared behind-the-scenes pictures from the Jaisalmer schedule.

Anuj Sachdeva shows injury marks after parking row, says no action by Mumbai Police Anuj Sachdeva has raised concerns over his safety following a reported assault in his Goregaon housing society, expressing frustration with the police response and posting images of his injuries online.

Baahubali The Epic OTT release: Rajamouli's film to make Christmas extra special SS Rajamouli's re-released film 'Baahubali: The Epic', an amalgamation of 'Baahubali: The Beginning' and 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion', will have a digital release following its theatrical debut on October 31.

Kartik says his relationship with Ananya is about love: No hatred or love-hate Kartik Aaryan discussed his evolving relationship with Ananya Panday as they reunite for their new romantic drama Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri. The actor said he's always had a "soft corner" for Ananya in his heart.

Sharman Joshi reacts to 3 Idiots sequel speculation: Hopeful this time Speculation around 3 Idiots 2 has resurfaced 15 years after the original film's release, with Sharman Joshi expressing hope while clarifying that he has not received official confirmation yet.

Sirai review: Vikram Prabhu film tackles minority struggle, bias with quiet strengthRelease Date:Wed Dec 24, 2025 Sirai movie review: Director Suresh Rajakumari's Sirai, starring Vikram Prabhu, LK Akshay Kumar and Anishma, is a crisp procedural drama. With restrained performances and exceptional social commentary on minority oppression, the film serves as a fitting conclusion to 2025.

Comedian Russell Brand faces new charges of rape and sexual assault Russell Brand has been charged with two further sexual offences, including rape, following an ongoing Metropolitan Police investigation. The entertainer will appear at Westminster Magistrates' Court in January 2026.

Ahaan Panday gets letter written in blood: Mother Deanne talks dark side of fame Ahaan Panday's Saiyaara performance has made him the new youth icon of 2025. His family faces both overwhelming love and unsettling fan behaviour as fame grows.

Mumtaz remembers Hema Malini's devotion to Dharmendra: She was truly in love Mumtaz reflected on Dharmendra's death, sharing insights about her visit to him in hospital. She also expressed her sympathy for Hema Malini, recalling her strong relationship with the legendary actor.

Dharmendra couldn't see Ikkis' final version; director Sriram Raghavan reveals why Director Sriram Raghavan shared details about late actor Dharmendra's involvement in the upcoming film 'Ikkis', including his preparation for the role and his final days before the film's release.

Idol I review: Kim Jae-young, Choi Soo-young add depth to familiar idol-fan fantasyRelease Date:Wed Dec 24, 2025 Idol I follows a criminal lawyer who secretly adores a troubled K-pop idol. The show exposes the emotional toll of fame and fan obsession behind the glamour.

Arjun Rampal on playing ISI Major in Dhurandhar: Wanted to get out of the character Arjun Rampal has received praise for his intense portrayal of ISI Major Iqbal in Dhurandhar, a role that saw him step away from his glam image. The actor said playing the antagonist was emotionally difficult, but he took it on for the film's significance.

Death certificates say Rob Reiner, wife Michele died of sharp force injuries According to their death certificates, filmmaker Rob Reiner and his wife, Michele, died from multiple sharp force injuries in their Los Angeles residence. The documents indicate the fatal injuries led to the couple's death within minutes.

Dhurandhar's Aditya Dhar reacts to film's criticism, corporate booking claims Aditya Dhar re-shared a note defending Dhurandhar's historic box office run, calling its success completely organic. The note took a veiled swipe at a 'video maker' critic while dismissing corporate booking claims.

Salman Khan, Dhoni, AP Dhillon in epic throwback pic, fans can't keep calm Atul Agnihotri posted a nostalgic image featuring Salman Khan, MS Dhoni, and singer AP Dhillon covered in mud at Salman Khan's Panvel farmhouse. The photo, shared ahead of Salman Khan's 60th birthday, captures the trio after an adventurous ATV ride during an informal gathering.

Ranbir Kapoor's Animal gears up for Japan release in 2026. Check date Ranbir Kapoor's hit film 'Animal' is all set to release in Japan after ruling hearts in India. The Sandeep Reddy Vanga directorial also stars Rashmika Mandanna, Anil Kapoor, and Bobby Deol in key roles.

Taylor Chase, Nickelodeon star, offered rent-free home after health crisis Taylor Chase, known for his role in Ned's Declassified School Survival Guide, has been found living on the streets of Riverside, California, prompting an outpouring of assistance and concern from former colleagues and the public.

Mysaa teaser: Rashmika Mandanna unleashes fierce new avatar in pan-India actioner The teaser of Mysaa introduces Rashmika Mandanna in a fierce new avatar, marking a bold shift from her recent roles. The pan-India, heroine-oriented action thriller promises an intense, emotionally driven narrative set against the backdrop of the Gond tribes.

Sean 'Diddy' Combs seeks immediate release from prison in appeal plea Sean 'Diddy' Combs' lawyers have filed an appeal in the 2nd US Circuit Court of Appeals, arguing his four-year prison sentence for prostitution-related offenses was unduly harsh and influenced by acquitted charges.

general news.headline: UP minister mocks Unnao rape survivor after being removed from Delhi protest"I wanted to kill myself then and there, but I stopped after thinking about my family," the survivor said on Tuesday after she and her mother were forcibly dragged out of the lawns of India Gate. A day later, Uttar Pradesh minister OP Rajbhar laughed off the incident.

We breathe 21K times a day: Court asks Centre to cut air purifier GST temporarilyIn strong remarks, the bench said the government has failed to provide clean air, so the least it can do is make air purifiers more accessible to the public.

Is Congress heading for another Priyanka Gandhi vs Rahul moment?Priyanka Gandhi: Voices within the Congress have grown stronger, calling for a key central role for Priyanka Gandhi, who has quickly transitioned from a behind-the-scenes strategist to a frontline shrewd politician. This was visible in the Parliament session. Now, a Congress MP's 'Priyanka for PM' chorus has created a buzz.

Virat Kohli marks Vijay Hazare Trophy return with a vintage hundred for DelhiReturning to the Vijay Hazare Trophy after nearly 15 years, Virat Kohli marked his comeback with a commanding century, reminding everyone why he remains one of the finest batters in the 50-over game.

Was Christmas moved from spring to December 25? Here are the factsPoet Javed Akhtar claimed that Christmas was moved from spring to December to coincide with a popular pagan festival to ease religious transition in ancient Rome. Historians, however, say that December 25 emerged as Christmas day through a complex mix of theology, symbolism, and circumstance rather than a single imperial decision.

Indian law student demolishes Pakistan in Oxford Union debateWhile Moosa Harraj, the Pakistani Oxford Union president, sabotaged a debate between Indian and Pakistani experts on terrorism, a students' version of the very same debate took place. Indian law student Viraansh Bhanushali destroyed Harraj by blending personal trauma and data, even as he exposed Pakistan's role in terrorism.

Rare snowfall in Saudi deserts: Can camels adapt and survive?Unprecedented snowfall across Saudi Arabia has left iconic desert camels struggling to navigate freezing temperatures and white landscapes.

10-year-old girl raped, killed in Odisha; unknown men demolish accused's housePreliminary findings by the police suggest that the child was sexually assaulted before being murdered, enraging the local community.

Coffee seller's 'on-the-go' setup goes viral. Internet can't stop watchingA young coffee seller's innovative setup and skillful preparation captured social media's attention and earned him praise for his creativity.

Indian student in US dies under suspicious circumstances while dining with friendsSoon after the incident, social media platforms were flooded with claims that Pawan Kumar Reddy died due to food poisoning. However, neither US authorities nor the medical department have officially confirmed food poisoning as the cause of death so far.

Al Hind Air, FlyExpress get NOCs as government looks to widen airline choicesAl Hind Air and FlyExpress have received no objection certificates from the civil aviation ministry, as the government looks to reduce heavy dependence on a few airlines following recent disruption at IndiGo.

Rare snowfall in Saudi deserts: Why it's a big warning for IndiaThe snowfall in the desert signalled to the world that something fundamental is shifting in the planet's climate system, and the consequences are visible.

Groped, hit: Woman assaulted on road by Instagram friend for rejecting proposalA woman in Bengaluru alleged sexual harassment after refusing a love proposal. The accused reportedly pulled her clothes and assaulted her in public. Police registered an FIR and launched a search for him.

Rohit Sharma hits 62-ball hundred, goes on six-hitting spree in JaipurVijay Hazare Trophy 2025-26: Rohit Sharma had hit eight sixes and nine boundaries when he got to his hundred in just 62 balls for Mumbai against Sikkim in Jaipur. Rohit was playing his first domestic 50-over game in eight years.

6.1 magnitude quake jolts Taiwan, buildings shake in TaipeiAccording to the local media outlet Taiwan News, the epicentre of the earthquake was located 10.1 kilometres north of Taitung County Hall.  The quake had a depth of 11.9 km (7.39 miles).

Nadella, Pichai help generously as Trump raises $2 billion, get rewardedAt least six Indian-origin individuals are among the over 300 donors who helped the Trump Presidency raise around $2 billion in 2025, an investigation by The New York Times has revealed. The donations are mostly transactional in nature, and those involved have benefited from the Trump administration, according to the report. Microsoft's Satya Nadella, Google's Sundar Pichai and the envoy to Singapore, Anjani Sinha, are among the Indian-origin donors.

Rs 7 crore for a mattress? Drake, Beyonce and Ronaldo think it's worth itWould you be willing to spend Rs 7-10 crore on a mattress for a good night's sleep? Your favourite celebrities are just doing it.

Karnataka-style Ram idol with gold, silver, diamonds to be installed at AyodhyaThe five-quintal-heavy and 7 feet-10-inch-tall idol will be installed at the proposed site near the Sant Tulsidas Temple, in the direction of Angad Tila.

Bigger and better: Conman Sukesh gifts mansion in Beverly Hills to actor JacquelineSukesh, while revealing his Christmas gift to actor Jacqueline Fernandez, says in the letter that he is sad that he is not able to see her bunny smile while revealing her special gift.

Indian-origin woman murdered in Toronto, suspect believed to be her partnerHimanshi Khurana, a 30-year-old Indian-origin woman, was found murdered in Toronto. Police suspect intimate partner violence and have issued a nationwide arrest warrant for a man identified as Abdul Ghafoori.

Salman Khan, Dhoni, AP Dhillon in epic throwback pic, fans can't keep calmAtul Agnihotri posted a nostalgic image featuring Salman Khan, MS Dhoni, and singer AP Dhillon covered in mud at Salman Khan's Panvel farmhouse. The photo, shared ahead of Salman Khan's 60th birthday, captures the trio after an adventurous ATV ride during an informal gathering.

CAT 2025 results released by IIM Kozhikode, 12 candidates score 100 percentile Live UpdatesThe results of CAT 2025, the national-level MBA entrance exam, have been officially announced by IIM Kozhikode. Candidates can now check their performance and download scorecards from the official CAT website. This year's exam saw a smooth conduct and high participation across the country.

Pakistan sells national carrier PIA for Rs 4,300 crore following bidding processThe privatisation ceremony was held in Islamabad and was attended by all three pre-qualified bidders. These included Lucky Cement, private airline Airblue and investment firm Arif Habib.

To save Mumbai: Uddhav, cousin Raj Thackeray reunite after 20 years for civic pollsShiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray and Maharashtra Navnirman Sena chief Raj Thackeray announced the tie-up for the upcoming BMC polls. Addressing the gathering, Uddhav Thackeray asserted that leadership of Maharashtra belongs to the Thackeray family. "Only Thackeray can lead Maharashtra."

sports.headline: Bavuma addresses Pant-Bumrah Bauna remark, reacts to Conrad's grovel comment Temba Bavuma said that Indian stars Jasprit Bumrah and Rishabh Pant apologised to him for the Bauna remark and reacted to the grovel comment made by South Africa coach Shukri Conrad during the Test series against India.

Jasprit Bumrah's no 1 Test rank in danger, Tilak Varma enters top 3 in T20Is India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah's reign at the top of the ICC bowling rankings is under threat as Pat Cummins jumped four places to be on the second spot. Tilak Varma has entered top 3 in T20Is, following his heroics against South Africa.

City group pulls out of Mumbai City FC due to Indian football uncertainty: Report In a big blow to Indian football, the City Football Group have decided to pull out of Mumbai City FC, according to a latest report. CFG have been asssociated with Mumbai since 2019 and helped change the fortunes of the club.

Virat Kohli marks Vijay Hazare Trophy return with a vintage hundred for Delhi Returning to the Vijay Hazare Trophy after nearly 15 years, Virat Kohli marked his comeback with a commanding century, reminding everyone why he remains one of the finest batters in the 50-over game.

Ravi Shastri backed to replace Brendon McCullum as England coach after Ashes defeat Former England spinner Monty Panesar has urged England to turn to Ravi Shastri as a replacement for Brendon McCullum, arguing that the ex-India coach's proven success against Australia makes him the ideal candidate to revive the team after a disappointing Ashes campaign.

Rohit Sharma hits 62-ball hundred, goes on six-hitting spree in Jaipur Vijay Hazare Trophy 2025-26: Rohit Sharma had hit eight sixes and nine boundaries when he got to his hundred in just 62 balls for Mumbai against Sikkim in Jaipur. Rohit was playing his first domestic 50-over game in eight years.

Keep it simple: Cameron Green told not to tinker his game for Ashes by Ponting Ricky Ponting has told Cameron Green to keep things simple and not to tinker with his game after his struggles in the ongoing Ashes 2025 series. Green has scored 76 in three Tests for Australia in Ashes 2025.

Rohit Sharma thrills Jaipur with quickfire fifty on Vijay Hazare return Rohit Sharma's long-awaited Vijay Hazare return turned into a Jaipur spectacle. The former India captain thrilled a packed Sawai Mansingh Stadium, racing to a 27-ball half-century that underlined his enduring class.

Vijay Hazare Trophy: Odisha's Swastik Samal scripts history, hits 212 off 169 balls Odisha's Swastik Samal created history as he scored a double hundred for Odisha against Saurashtra in Alur on Wednesday, December 24. Samal's knock helped Odisha scored 345 for six against Saurashtra in the Vijay Hazare Trophy.

Virat Kohli emulates Sachin, becomes second Indian to 16,000 List A runs Virat Kohli celebrated his return to domestic cricket by becoming only the second Indian batter after Sachin Tendulkar to complete 16,000 runs in List A cricket.

Bihar 574. Vaibhav 190. Gani 128. World records tumble in Vijay Hazare Trophy Bihar finished with a mammoth 574 for 6, shattering the previous List A record held by Tamil Nadu, who had posted 506 for 2 against Arunachal Pradesh in the same tournament in 2022. The historic batting effort was led by centuries from Vaibhav Suryavanshi (190), Ayush Loharuka (116) and Sakibul Gani.

After T20 World Cup selection, Kishan slams 33-ball 100 in Vijay Hazare TrophyIshan Kishan celebrated his Team India selection with a stunning 33-ball century in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. His explosive innings helped Jharkhand post a massive score of 412/9.

Vijay Hazare: Bihar captain smashes 32-ball 100, fastest by Indian in List ABihar captain Sakibul Gani set a new record for the fastest List A century by an Indian. His innings helped Bihar post the highest ever List A team total of 574/6.

Jofra Archer breaks down again, Pope axed as England name Boxing Day Test XIEngland's Ashes campaign worsens as Jofra Archer is ruled out with a side strain. The team also drops Ollie Pope amid poor form, signalling major changes ahead of the Boxing Day Test.

Brendon McCullum's Lasso-way with England has turned into one harsh reality checkBrendon McCullum's Ted Lasso-style belief reshaped England's Test cricket. Australia's Ashes summer showed that optimism alone fades quickly without preparation and adaptability.

Rohit Sharma fever in Jaipur: Over 10,000 turn up, stadium echoes with chantsVijay Hazare Trophy 2025: Over 10,000 fans turned up to watch Rohit Sharma's return to the premier domestic 50-over tournament at the Sawai Mansingh Stadium on Wednesday, December 24. Rohit took the field for Mumbai against Sikkim while Virat Kohli played for Delhi against Andhra in Bengaluru.

Kohli's captaincy had high expectations but ended in disappointment: Tom MoodyTom Moody has given a blunt verdict on Virat Kohli's captaincy tenure, calling it disappointing. However, AB de Villiers said that it's unfair to judge a captain by only ICC trophies.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi smashes 2nd fastest Vijay Hazare 100Vaibhav Suryavanshi responded to Asia Cup disappointment with a stunning Vijay Hazare century. The 14-year-old's record-breaking knock reinforced his reputation as one of India's most exciting young batting talents.

Ben Stokes stands by England players amid drinking allegations: I'll protect themBen Stokes closed ranks around his squad as England's Ashes turmoil deepened in Australia. With scrutiny intensifying off the field, the captain prioritised player welfare while chasing pride in the final Tests.

Venus Williams marries actor Andrea Preti, sister Serena has a sweet messageVenus Williams married Italian actor Andrea Preti in a private ceremony. Serena Williams shared an emotional tribute celebrating their lifelong bond and Venus's new chapter.

Manchester City closing in on Antoine Semenyo deal after United snub: ReportsAntoine Semenyo's January future is quickly becoming one of the Premier League's biggest talking points. With Manchester City in pole position, Bournemouth now face a race against the release-clause clock.

Mohammad Kaif slams BCCI for Gill blunder: Indian cricket has gone behindMohammad Kaif has criticised the Indian selectors for their move regarding Shubman Gill and the T20I side. He said that Indian cricket has gone behind due to their lack of planning.

Ishan Kishan is back, but is team India ready to trust him long-term?Ishan Kishan has returned to team India after two years of silence. After taking a break for personal reasons in December 2023, he also lost his central contract. During this period, he continued to perform consistently in domestic cricket and stormed his way back into the team.

Leave Vaibhav Suryavanshi alone. Moral policing a 15-year-old helps no oneMoral policing a 15-year-old won't build champions. Patience might. Vaibhav Suryavanshi's mistake was human. Our reaction was not.

Rob Key backs Brendon McCullum despite England's Ashes horror in AustraliaRob Key closed ranks around Brendon McCullum after England's Ashes collapse in Australia. Admitting failures in preparation and execution, England's leadership now face a decisive moment to evolve their approach.

Sports news today Live: Ro-Ko fire in Vijay Hazare, Bihar break world recordToday's Sports News Live Updates: Rohit Sharma has smashed a 36-ball fifty while Virat Kohli has gotten off to a brisk start in Delhi's chase against Andhra in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Earlier in the day, Bihar broke the world record, scoring 574 after Vaibhav Suryavanshi's 190. Venus Williams, meanwhile, announced her marriage with Italian actor Andrea Preti.

Kepa becomes Arsenal's penalty hero in Carabao Cup thriller vs Crystal PalaceKepa Arrizabalaga delivered when pressure peaked, sealing Arsenal's Carabao Cup semi-final spot. As the season gathers momentum, Mikel Arteta's side continue to prove their depth and belief across competitions.

Virat Kohli returns to VHT: What was the cricket world like before his last match?Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are set to make their return in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Rohit will be playing in the tournament for the first time since 2018, while Kohli marks his comeback after a 15-year hiatus.

Rohit-Kohli take centre stage, but stories aplenty in Round 1The Vijay Hazare Trophy begins on December 24, Wednesday. On Christmas Eve there are many storylines that will keep the fans hooked to the competition. Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma will take centre stage but keep an eye out on others as well. Here is the preview of the Round 1 fixtures.

Security steps in as fans hound Rohit Sharma for selfies in JaipurRohit Sharma is in Jaipur to play Vijay Hazare Trophy. Fans thronged to the batter to click selfies after Rohit's net session at the Sawai Man Singh Stadium. One of them misbehaved and was swiftly removed by the security.

No Williamson vs Kohli as New Zealand announce white ball squads for India tourIndia vs New Zealand: The Blackcaps announced their white ball squads for the series against India. Senior batter Kane Williamson is set to skip the series, while top players return for the T20I leg ahead of the World Cup.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
